com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface WMIInfoConnectionParameters

All Superinterfaces:
WindowsInfoConnectionParameters
public interface WMIInfoConnectionParameters
extends WindowsInfoConnectionParameters

Parameters that are specific to WMI connections. This includes a variety of encryption, authentication, and desired permission settings.

Method Summary
 WMIAuthenticationLevel getAuthenticationLevel()
          Returns the authentication level that will be used when a COM connection is established by WMI.
 WMIImpersonationLevel getImpersontationLevel()
          Returns the impersonation level that will be used when a COM connection is established by WMI.
 java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrivileges()
          Returns the collection of privileges that will be asked for when WMI establishes a connection using these parameters.
 void setAuthenticationLevel(WMIAuthenticationLevel authenticationLevel)
          Sets the authentication level that is used by COM when a WMI connection is made.
 void setImpersonationLevel(WMIImpersonationLevel impersonationLevel)
          Sets the impersonation level that will be used by WMI when it establishes COM connections.
 void setPrivileges(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> privileges)
          Sets the collection of privileges that will be requested when a WMI connection is established using these parameters.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.quest.glue.api.services.WindowsInfoConnectionParameters
getHostname, getNamespace, getTags, getTimeout, setHostname, setNamespace, setTags, setTimeout
 

Method Detail

getAuthenticationLevel

WMIAuthenticationLevel getAuthenticationLevel()
Returns the authentication level that will be used when a COM connection is established by WMI.

Returns:
The COM authentication level used by WMI when a connection is established

getImpersontationLevel

WMIImpersonationLevel getImpersontationLevel()
Returns the impersonation level that will be used when a COM connection is established by WMI.

Returns:
The impersontaion level used by COM when a connection is established by WMI

getPrivileges

java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrivileges()
Returns the collection of privileges that will be asked for when WMI establishes a connection using these parameters. If no privileges have been specifically asked for then this method will return null to indicate the default set. An empty collection indicates that the connection is explicitly asking for no privileges.

Returns:
The set of privileges that will be requested when a connection is opened with these parameters or null if nothing specific has been requested

setAuthenticationLevel

void setAuthenticationLevel(WMIAuthenticationLevel authenticationLevel)
Sets the authentication level that is used by COM when a WMI connection is made. Providing a null authentication level will allow WMI to use whatever level it feels is most appropriate.

Parameters:
authenticationLevel - The authentication level applied to COM connections made by WMI

setImpersonationLevel

void setImpersonationLevel(WMIImpersonationLevel impersonationLevel)
Sets the impersonation level that will be used by WMI when it establishes COM connections. Providing a null impersonation level allows WMI to use whatever level it feels is most appropriate.

Parameters:
impersonationLevel - The impersonation level used when a COM connection is established by WMI

setPrivileges

void setPrivileges(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> privileges)
Sets the collection of privileges that will be requested when a WMI connection is established using these parameters. Providing null for these privileges indicates that the default set of privileges should be used. An empty set indicates that no privileges will be available when the connection is opened.

Parameters:
privileges - The new set of privileges that will be requested or null to request the default set
